alert.note: Alert for Elbert; Lincoln (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 12 at 2:18PM MDT until June 12 at 5:30PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: The National Weather Service in Denver has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southeastern Elbert County in east central Colorado... North Central Lincoln County in east central Colorado... * Until 530 PM MDT. * At 218 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, gulches, roads, and poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Limon, Genoa and Matheson. This includes the following streams and drainages... North Rush Creek, Big Sandy Creek, Middle Rush Creek, Lake Creek, Dugout Creek, Antelope Creek, East Bijou Creek, Mustang Creek, Long Creek, Apache Creek, South Rush Creek and Hell Creek. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Excessive runoff from this storm will cause flash flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
